item.title: 中国的空气污染问题正在追随西方工业：CREA
item.description: 根据能源与清洁空气研究中心（Centre for Research on Energy and Clean Air）的一份新报告，中国推动重工业向西部地区转移的做法正在损害西部地区的空气质量，即使整个国家的空气质量有所改善。【原文：China’s push to move heavy industry into its western regions is hurting air quality there even as it improves for the nation as a whole, according to a new report from the Centre for Research on Energy and Clean Air.】

item.title: 数据中心为美国最大电网增加 94 亿美元成本
item.description: 据一家市场观察机构发布的报告称，与美国最大电网相连的数据中心的快速发展使成本增加了 94 亿美元，增幅达 180%。【原文：The rapid development of data centers connected to the largest US electric grid raised costs by $9.4 billion, a 180% increase, according to a report published by a market observer.】

item.title: 津巴布韦将允许宰杀 50 头大象以遏制过度繁殖
item.description: 津巴布韦将允许在一个重要的保护区杀死 50 头大象，作为管理日益增长的哺乳动物种群的努力的一部分。【原文：Zimbabwe will allow the killing of 50 elephants at a key conservancy area as part of efforts to manage growing populations of the mammals, which have led to increased human-wildlife conflict and put pressure on the environment.】

item.title: 贝莱德在环境、社会和管治（ESG）方面做出让步，逃出得克萨斯州石油抵制黑名单
item.description: 贝莱德公司从得克萨斯州抵制化石燃料的公司黑名单中除名，结束了因全球最大资产管理公司的环境政策而持续三年的对峙。【原文：BlackRock Inc. was removed from Texas’ blacklist of companies that boycott fossil fuels, ending a three-year standoff over the environmental policies of the world’s largest asset manager.】

item.title: 杰富瑞称 Meta 的核电交易可能比微软便宜
item.description: 对运行人工智能所需的电力需求激增，促使 Meta Platforms 公司与美国最大的核电运营商签订了一份为期 20 年的合同，该协议的价格可能比竞争对手微软公司去年签订的类似协议更便宜。【原文：Surging demand for power to run artificial intelligence just prompted Meta Platforms Inc. to enter a 20-year contract with the biggest US nuclear operator, penning a deal that’s likely to be priced at a cheaper rate than a similar agreement rival Microsoft Corp. entered last year.】

item.title: 杰富瑞称 Meta 的核电交易可能比微软便宜
item.description: 对运行人工智能所需的电力需求激增，促使 Meta Platforms 公司与美国最大的核电运营商签订了一份为期 20 年的合同，该协议的价格可能比竞争对手微软公司去年签订的类似协议更便宜。【原文：Surging demand for power to run artificial intelligence just prompted Meta Platforms Inc. to enter a 20-year contract with the biggest US nuclear operator, penning a deal that’s likely to be priced at a cheaper rate than a similar agreement rival Microsoft Corp. entered last year.】

item.title: 降雨减缓部分火势蔓延，阿尔伯塔省火灾威胁趋于稳定
item.description: 由于降雨减缓了一些大火的蔓延，阿尔伯塔省的野火威胁趋于稳定，这些大火迫使人们撤离，并关闭了加拿大约 7% 的石油日产量。【原文：Alberta’s wildfire threat stabilized as rain slowed the growth of some blazes that have forced evacuations and shut about 7% of Canada’s daily oil production.】

item.title: 刚果从世界银行获得 10 亿美元资金用于重启大型水电计划
item.description: 世界银行表示，它将承诺提供 10 亿美元，帮助刚果民主共和国为可能成为世界上最大水电项目的下一阶段开发做好准备。【原文：The World Bank said it is committing $1 billion to help the Democratic Republic of Congo prepare for the development of the next stage of what could be the world’s biggest hydropower project.】

item.title: 基什内尔回国有可能分裂反对党，这对米莱伊有利
item.description: 克里斯蒂娜-费尔南德斯-德基什内尔自哈维尔-米莱伊总统上任以来首次重返阿根廷政坛，她将在即将举行的地方投票中挑战自由主义者，并在自己的庇隆主义党内争夺权力。【原文：Cristina Fernandez de Kirchner is back on Argentina’s political scene for the first time since President Javier Milei took office, set to challenge the libertarian and contest power within her own Peronist party in an upcoming local vote.】

item.title: 这种低技术含量的解决方案最多可减少 24% 的船舶排放
item.description:
数字 OpenTable 式预订系统帮助洛杉矶港口减少了船只拥堵和污染。【原文：

A digital OpenTable-style reservation system helped Los Angeles ports reduce vessel congestion and pollution.

】

item.title: 瑞士冰川崩塌是气候灾害管理的一堂课
item.description:
瑞士当局在白桦冰川崩塌前几天疏散了布拉滕镇的居民，但大多数国家都不具备这样的资源。【原文：

Swiss authorities evacuated the town of Blatten days before the Birch glacier collapsed, but the resources that allowed them to do that are not available to most countries.

】

item.title: 破解让旧衣焕然一新的密码
item.description:
废弃衣物是环境公害。但是，在欧洲各地，一些公司正在联合起来，开发新技术，使回收再利用成为可能。【原文：

Discarded clothing is an environmental scourge. But across Europe, companies are joining forces to build new technologies that could make recycling scalable.

】

item.title: H&M 在时装绿色成绩单上的表现优于 Zara 和 Shein
item.description:
在今年的 "无化石时尚记分卡 "上，这些品牌分别获得了B+、C和F。【原文：

The brands respectively got a B+, a C and an F on this year’s Fossil-Free Fashion Scorecard.

】

item.title: 气候投资者 Energize 为新的风险投资基金融资 4.3 亿美元
item.description: 气候技术投资公司 Energize Capital 为一个新基金筹集了 4.3 亿美元，该基金的目标是从事新型电池和电网软件等项目的早期初创企业。【原文：The climate tech investment firm Energize Capital has raised $430 million for a new fund targeting early-stage startups working on projects like new batteries and software for the electric grid.】

item.title: 人工智能需求激增，Meta 将向 Constellation 购买核电
item.description: Constellation Energy Corp. 同意向 Meta Platforms Inc. 出售伊利诺伊州一座运行中核电站的电力，随着人工智能使电力需求激增，这项交易可能会推动在该核电站建造一座新反应堆。【原文：Constellation Energy Corp. agreed to sell power from an operating Illinois nuclear plant to Meta Platforms Inc., a deal that could spur construction of a new reactor at the site as artificial intelligence sends power demand soaring.】

item.title: 投资者表示，他们正在摒弃将环境、社会和治理视为 "总括概念 "的做法
item.description:
晨星全球调查中受访的资产所有者认为，投资工具已变得过于两极分化。【原文：

The investment tool has become too polarizing, according to asset owners interviewed in global Morningstar survey.

】

item.title: 摩根大通银行家警告清洁技术面临硅谷陷阱
item.description: 事实证明，在硅谷磨练和完善的风险投资模式并不适合清洁技术产业，投资者应该接受他们需要在更长的时间内投入更大的资金。【原文：The venture capital model honed and perfected in Silicon Valley is proving a bad fit for the clean tech industry, and investors should instead accept that they’ll need to commit much bigger sums of money for longer periods of time.】

item.title: 特朗普计划利用拜登的绿色银行提供数十亿美元贷款
item.description: 根据政府 2026 财年预算申请的详细内容，特朗普政府计划利用总统曾试图扼杀的 4000 亿美元绿色银行，为核反应堆、地热发电和关键矿产提供数十亿美元的贷款。【原文：The Trump administration plans to use a $400 billion green bank the president once sought to kill to finance billions of dollars in loans for nuclear reactors, geothermal power and critical minerals, according to details of the administration’s fiscal year 2026 budget request.】

item.title: 阿尔伯塔省野火导致加拿大约 7% 的石油生产停产
item.description: 加拿大能源中心地带阿尔伯塔省的野火导致该省近 35 万桶重质原油日产量停产，约占全国产量的 7%。【原文：Wildfires in Canada’s energy heartland of Alberta have shut down almost 350,000 barrels of daily heavy crude production — about 7% of the country’s output — as a major blaze near the province’s eastern border menaces oil sands operations.】

item.title: 意大利埃特纳火山爆发，腾起大量浓烟
item.description: 意大利埃特纳火山周一爆发，腾起大量烟雾，游客纷纷躲避。【原文：Italy’s Mount Etna erupted Monday, setting off large clouds of smoke and causing tourists to seek shelter.】

item.title: 法国修订海上风电场合同以缓解电力过剩问题
item.description: 法国政府与三家海上风力发电场签署了购电协议修正案，允许它们在负价格期间削减部分或全部产量。【原文：The French government and three offshore wind power farms signed amendments to power-purchase agreements, allowing them to curtail part or all of their production during periods of negative prices.】

item.title: 燃烧的道路、入侵的章鱼预示着炎热的夏季即将到来
item.description: 今天的时事通讯关注北半球即将到来的夏季，以及气候变化带来的各种令人不安、令人惊讶和奇怪的影响。请继续阅读，或在彭博网站上了解有关烘烤公路、新员工高温法和英国章鱼入侵的完整故事。如需无限制地获取气候和能源新闻，请订阅。【原文：Today’s newsletter looks at the summer ahead for the Northern Hemisphere and all of the troubling, surprising and weird impacts climate change is creating. Read on or get the full story on baking highways, new employee heat laws and a British octopus invasion on Bloomberg.com. For unlimited access to climate and energy news, please subscribe.】

item.title: 加拿大大火产生的烟雾正在英国上空弥漫
item.description: 在加拿大燃烧的大规模野火产生的烟雾已经越过大西洋，吹到了英国上空。【原文：Smoke from massive wildfires burning in Canada has crossed the Atlantic Ocean and is blowing over the UK.】

item.title: 特朗普计划卸载国家公园用地，但各州却不想要
item.description:
白宫希望通过将一些公园移交给州和部落管理来削减国家公园管理局的预算。各州说他们的资源已经很紧张了。【原文：

The White House wants to trim the National Park Service budget by transferring some parks to state and tribal management. States say their resources are already tight.

】

item.title: 中国煤炭行业有一个肮脏的大秘密
item.description:
一个不起眼的行业角落已达到了巨大的规模，但却几乎未引起人们的注意。【原文：

Largely unnoticed, an obscure corner of the trade has reached gargantuan proportions. 

】

item.title: 日本要求企业保护工人免受热浪侵袭，否则将被罚款
item.description:
在 2024 年员工受到酷暑影响后，国家政府出台了更严厉的法律。【原文：

The nation’s government has unveiled tougher legislation after employees were impacted by fierce summer temperatures in 2024.

】

item.title: 华氏 158 度的高温预示着从中国到美国的炎热夏季
item.description:
未来几个月的酷热天气可能会给电网带来压力，使农作物枯萎，并造成数十亿美元的经济损失。【原文：

Extreme heat in the coming months threatens to tax power grids, wilt crops and inflict billions of dollars in economic losses.

】

item.title: 加拿大野火迫使油砂区居民撤离，石油运输中断
item.description: 加拿大西部野火肆虐，迫使成千上万人逃离家园，现在也促使人们撤离阿尔伯塔省北部的油砂项目。【原文：Raging Western Canadian wildfires that have forced thousands of people from their homes are now also prompting evacuations from oilsands projects in northern Alberta.】

item.title: Meyer Burger 因两家公司申请破产而推迟发布财报
item.description: 陷入困境的太阳能模块制造商 Meyer Burger Technology AG 在其德国子公司申请破产程序后，要求延长提交 2024 年财务报告的最后期限。【原文：Struggling solar-module manufacturer Meyer Burger Technology AG requested an extension of the deadline to present its 2024 financial results after its German units filed for insolvency proceedings.】

item.title: 气温达到 26 摄氏度，英国有史以来最晴朗的春季温暖落幕
item.description: 周六，英国气温达到 26 摄氏度，在英国正式进入夏季之前，结束了有记录以来最晴朗的春季。【原文：UK temperatures hit 26C on Saturday, wrapping up the sunniest spring on record before the country officially goes into the summer season.】
